idioms.reading: せいりょくはくちゅう
idioms.meaning: (two sides) being evenly matched in influence or power
conservatives and reformists being neck and neck

idioms.reading: じつりょくはくちゅう
idioms.meaning: (the two persons' sides) being evenly matched in ability
relationship based on intuitive understanding of each other

idioms.word: 親しき仲にも礼儀あり
idioms.reading: したしきなかにもれいぎあり

idioms.word: 近しき仲にも垣を結え
idioms.reading: ちかしきなかにもかきをゆえ

idioms.word: 二人は伴侶、三人は仲間割れ
idioms.reading: ふたりははんりょ、さんにんはなかまわれ
idioms.meaning: two is a company, three is a crowd

lessons.japanese: 君とぼくは仲がよいが、共通するものはほとんどない。
lessons.english: You and I are good friends, but we have little in common.

lessons.japanese: 君が仲間に加われないのは残念だ。
lessons.english: It is a pity that you can't join us.

lessons.japanese: 近所の人とは仲良くしなければなりません。
lessons.english: You must be friendly with your neighbors.

lessons.japanese: 外国から来た人々と仲良くやっていこうとするのは大切だ。
lessons.english: It is important to try to get along with people from foreign countries.
